text: Skelbo Castle is a ruined 14th century keep, located near Dornoch, Sutherland, Scotland. The remaining wall is best preserved at the northern side of the castle. The remains are protected as a scheduled monument. ==History== In 1235, the castle was granted to Richard de Moravia by his brother Gilbert de Moravia the Bishop of Caithness. In 1308, Robert the Bruce captured a castle at the site belonging to the Sutherlands. In 1494 Marjory Mowat widow of John of Kinnaird disputed ownership of the castle with Thomas of Kinnaird. The court ordered a lawyer to interview the witnesses to a charter.Acts of the Lords Auditors of Causes and Complaints (Edinburgh, 1839), p. 203-4. In 1529 the castle was bought by William Sutherland of Duffus. A 16th-century house was built adjacent, but the whole site was abandoned as a residence in the 20th century. * Mikhail de Buar (d.2009) - last owner of the castle, who died without the testament. His legacy is now the subject of a major scandal and litigation in Russia. ==See also== *Castles in Scotland ==References== ==External links== * * * * Category:Castles in Highland (council area) Category:Scheduled Ancient Monuments in Highland Category:Listed castles in Scotland Category:Ruined castles in Highland (council area) Category:Buildings and structures in Sutherland
